title.narrative: EVIDENCE GENERATION

description.narrative: UNICEF Angola generates quality evidence in sectors related to children's rights, informing policy and budgetary frameworks, which contributes to Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2019, the most vulnerable boys and girls will have increased access to social assistance programs, through improvement of policy environment and systems

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF Angola generates quality evidence in sectors related to children's rights, informing policy and budgetary frameworks

description.narrative: Enhanced Public Finance for Children (PF4C) work in Angola: Key decision makers have used the child focused budget analysis to inform the allocation of public funds; partnerships with national partners strengthened, resulting in improved PF4C advocacy agenda. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/07/2019

title.narrative: Number of high quality social sector budget briefs based on the state budget produced and broadly disseminated(36932)
Number of additional high quality studies produced and disseminated that inform government social policy and programming(59484)

target.value: 2019:Disseminate lessons from decentralised social action model and cash transfers

actual.value: 2019:Two substantive studies were undertaken in the provinces targeted by the Social Cash Transfers Program in 2019: a KAP Study on nutrition, health, WASH and VAC; and the Baseline Study, based on a total sample of 2,500 households in treatment and control ar

title.narrative: High quality multidimensional poverty analysis (MODA) report produced and disseminated(50030)

target.value: 2019:MODA analysis disseminated by national institute for statistics

actual.value: 2019:INE have used MODA as the main resource in discussion with the WB for a loan to support cash transfer.
